  Hi,


I studied the Junitperf user guide.  But, i am not able to run 
te=
stcases.  Can i have step by step approach to run junitperf testcases? 
Is =
it possible to get the output by using any GUI (Swing, AWT 
Components, etc=
.)



regards,

Madhan Kumar



On Wed, Jul 25, 2007 at  4:49 AM, J. B. Rai=
nsberger wrote:



tripdavid wrote:


> What is the best approach for handi=
ng a situation where a project

> exists that represents an API to other pr=
ojects?

>

> For example: Project1 and Project2 are separate projects whic=
h depend

> on apiproject.

>

> Changes are made to apiproject, such that =
the tests within apiproject

> pass.

>

> But, those changes would now bre=
ak project1 and project2.

>

> Would the solution be:

> a) when changes a=
re made to apiproject, automatically fire off the

> tests for dependent pr=
ojects (in this case Project1 and Project2)?

>

> b) Plan to run tests at =
periodic intervals of Project1 and Project2,

> so that eventually, the bre=
ak will become apparent?

>

> We plan to use CruiseControl to do automated=
 builds and tests. Just

> not sure how we can know when code in an api (su=
bproject? ) will break

> the dependent projects.


I would probably have a=
 set of acceptance tests (in the classical sense,

not the XP sense) in Pro=
ject 1 that checks the key parts of APIProject

that Project 1 uses. Run th=
ose tests as part of Project 1's regular

build. This way, if APIProject fa=
ils in a way that Project 1 cares

about, you'll know.


Of course, even be=
tter would be for APIProject to have a separate

release schedule so that P=
roject 1 can do some checking before it

upgrades its version of APIProject=
. This way, those tests need not be

part of every Project 1 build.


Do ei=
ther of these suggestions help you?
